sub_title: Materials Science, Research, and Development | Engineering | Innovation Management | PhD in Polymer Chemistry
summary:
I am interested in pursuing a career with a globally recognized, leading-edge company, where I can develop myself professionally in a challenging international environment, while making meaningful managerial and research contributions.

Building on my extensive and diverse research background in organic and polymer chemistry, engineering, analysis and materials sciences up to the nanoscale, I would like to start with a dynamic job in research,  development, or engineering while exploring the areas of innovation and business management.

People recognize me as a diligent and resourceful person with a keen perceptive eye for the team dynamics and a learning attitude.

6, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}, 'end': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'company': 'Eindhoven University of Technology', 'description': 'Graduated on the 1st of October in the research group of Prof. Dr. E.W. Meijer, on "Folding Polymer Chains - An Interplay of Supramolecular Interactions"

During my PhD research, I combined the fields of organic and polymer chemistry to create novel dynamic materials. By employing a broad  spectrum of synthetic and characterization techniques, I gained an in-depth insight in the complex interplay of interactions that governs the material. Hereby, I developed the skills required to think at a molecular level as well as control and analyze material properties up to the nanoscale.

Supervisors: Prof. Dr. E.W. Meijer, Prof. Dr. Ir. I.K. Voets, and Dr. Ir. A.R.A. Palmans.', 'title': 'PhD in Chemistry with Prof. Dr. E.W. Meijer', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 1009, 'name': 'IBM', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D560BAQGiz5ecgpCtkA/company-logo_400_400/0/1688684715427?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=u5Re06Myc9BstE2M6qN9MMORKODl8XmTlCBTPMoVtXk', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/ibm/', 'employees': {'start': 10001, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}, 'end': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'San Jose, USA', 'date': {'start': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}, 'end': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}}, 'company': 'IBM', 'description': 'At IBM Research Almaden, our team developed an innovative class of recyclable thermosetting polymers and organogels.

Thermoset polymers are commonly used in many high-performance plastics, due to their high mechanical strength and durability. However, a major drawback of these properties is that such materials are typically difficult to recycle and/or repair. Aiming for a circular economy, in which such high-performance materials are regenerated instead of disposed, we made a crucial set towards recyclable thermoset plastics and organogels. In contrast to ordinary thermoset polymers, the developed materials can be returned to their monomeric state through a pH trigger. I contributed to this project by studying the chemistry on both a fundamental and material level.

Supervisors: Dr. J.M. Garcia,  Dr. J.L. Hedrick,  IBM Research Almaden, San Jose, USA.', 'title': 'Research Internship – IBM Research Almaden, USA', 'employment_type': None}]}]
